sentence.Network_en: The wounds may heal cleanly or they may ooze a clear liquid.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些伤口可能会利索地愈合，也可能会分泌出一种透明的液体。

sentence.Network_en: Outwardly, Graham will ooze all his old confidence.
sentence.Network_cn: 格雷厄姆表面上看起来会像过去一样满怀信心。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wōs 'juice or sap'; the verb dates from late Middle English

Old English wāse; related to Old Norse veisa 'stagnant pool'. In Middle English and the 16th cent. the spelling was wose (rhyming with repose), but from 1550 spellings imply a change in pronunciation and influence by ooze

entry.def: When a thick or sticky liquid oozes from something or when something oozes it, the liquid flows slowly and in small quantities.

example.ex: He saw there was a big hole in the back of the man's head, blood was still oozing from it...
example.tran: 他看到这个男人后脑勺上有道大口子，血还在往外渗。

example.ex: The lava will just ooze gently out of the crater...
example.tran: 岩浆就会从火山口缓缓涌流出来。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something oozes a quality or characteristic, or oozes with it, you mean that they show it very strongly.

example.ex: Outwardly, Graham will ooze all his old confidence...
example.tran: 格雷厄姆表面上看起来会像过去一样满怀信心。
这幢伊丽莎白时期的房子散发着迷人的魅力。

entry.tran: （尤指河、湖、海底的）软泥，淤泥，泥浆
entry.def: You can refer to any thick, sticky, liquid substance as ooze, especially the mud at the bottom of a river, lake, or the sea.

example.ex: He grabbed into the ooze and came up clutching a large toad.
example.tran: 他把手伸进淤泥里捞摸，结果抓上来一只巨大的蟾蜍。

means.word_mean: 1. pass gradually or leak through or as if through small openings
2. release (a liquid) in drops or small quantities;

auth_sentence.content: The paramedics rescue a man trapped in the ooze of a gushing oil well.
auth_sentence.res_content: The paramedics rescue a man trapped in the ooze of a gushing oil well.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The paramedics rescue a man trapped in the ooze of a gushing oil well.

auth_sentence.content: Much of Hong Kong fears China's notorious corruption will ooze across the border.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Much of Hong Kong fears China's notorious corruption will ooze across the border.

auth_sentence.content: My son i' th' ooze is bedded; and I'll seek him deeper than e'er plummet sounded.
auth_sentence.res_content: My son i' th' ooze is bedded; and I'll seek him deeper than e'er plummet sounded.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My son i' th' ooze is bedded; and I'll seek him deeper than e'er plummet sounded.

means.word_mean: (浓液等)慢慢地冒出, 渗出

sentences.en: Blood was oozing out of the wound on his leg.
sentences.cn: 血正从他腿上的伤口渗出来。

sentences.en: Cream was oozing out of the cake.
sentences.cn: 奶油从蛋糕里慢慢地流出来。

sentences.en: cakes with cream oozing out at the sides
Blood was oozing from the cut on her arm.
sentences.cn: 那时她胳膊上的伤口冒着血。
